title.rendered: Inventing the Technique of Color Photography

content.rendered:
Accidents happen every day in the world. Many things are invented. Many are born and die. Do we remember all the daily events? However, some things are permanently etched in people’s minds, some events go down in the pages of history. Our regular event ‘This Day in History’ deals with such topics. Today is November 23. Let’s see what happened in the world today. Translated from the book ‘On This Day: A History of the World in 366 Days

The journey of color photography began with the hands of the French inventor Louis Ducot du Hauron. He invented the technique of adding color to photographs. On November 23, 1868, he patented the technique. This invention revolutionized the world of color photography.

First play on stage

The time is 543 BC. The first play was staged in ancient Greece on November 23 of that year. A man named Thespis from the island of Icaria took the stage for the first time to perform.

The Netherlands gets its first female ruler

In the Netherlands, women were once not allowed to be rulers. After the death of King William III, the country fell into crisis. He left no male heir. Therefore, the country’s constitution should be amended. On this day in 1890 a new law was passed. Princess Wilhelmina, daughter of King William III, took the throne under this law. She became the queen when she was only 10 years old.
